review_title: High workload, high expectations with LOW pay
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros:
Good starting place to get into support work. 
Majority of staff just want the best for people with learning disabilities. 
Genuinely some really great people work there. 
If management like you, you will progress in your career at Hft.
cons:
- Very low pay - one of the lowest in the industry. 
- work load is immense and unrelenting and ignoring it is managements strategy for dealing with it. "We are all busy" is the common phrase reiterated to me when I raised this. 
- Job descriptions do not accurately reflect what the job is you actually do. You always do more. 
- The organisation as a whole is very bureauocratic. 
- Depending on the location the services itself and the staff can be quite institutionalised and 'old school'
- How you are treated and the opportunities you are offered will depend solely on your direct line manager. 
- Managers often play favourites with particular staff and will set different standards and expectations for different staff at the same level. 
- Management are so busy chasing after their goals and getting staff to do extra for these goals, they forget to look back and check on how the actual team is handling it all. Which more often than not, is not well. 
- The constant focus on projects and things that look good for Loca Authority commissioners can take away from actually focussing on quality support.

job_title: Support Worker in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Bad management, poor travel and poor service
cons:
Disability discrimination,
bullying by staff and management,
Using Person first language
using physical restrain on supported inviduales based on ABA and PBS
outdated facilities in bradford
poor records of indviduals health and conditions.
support plans not being frequently updated.
service for older people not being engaging 
poor pay levels
supported individuals being put on inapropriate services
Disabled voices not beeen used apropriately 

Although my job is rewarding, i am not impressed with how the company treats its employees who are autistic. during my time i got good relevant training but i wasnt given fair oppertunities to use those skills. I am autistic and only just got my care certificate after working there for 1 year and 3 months, during that time period i completed my theory care certificate within 3 months however my practical side was not done until this year and this was because managers lack of willing to let me use my skill set and managers overreacting at the possibility of my autism interfeering with my job. also managers loosing my practical notes because i did a better job than other staff members

i have been shunted around from several hubs, within this time scale and also had a manager who discriminated against me based on myself being autistic and giving me menial task to do despite having a Bachaors degree, however i can say that i have had a few good coleagues to work with whilst other constantly criticised how i was working when i was using initiative, skill and following support plans. i was told off for eating non halal food. i wastold i was nto doing enough personal care when i was doing more than enough. i even stepped up when a person we supported had a seizure and took charge of the hub when senior staff had to go to the hospital and other staff were out in the car. Despite showing this initiative and leadership managment gaslit me and falsified claims that i was asleep at work. when in fact i ws struggling to cope when the tempreture in the building ws hot and liek a greenhouse which for many people can cause drowsiness.

in some parts i  had some support from one manager and hub leader however, 3 previous managers have failed to help me feel included in a team. i have been scratched, bitten, headbutted and grabbed where i have been left with physical brusises and marks upon my body, also managers told me off for being literal as i written up incident forms,

The salary that support get in bradford is abysmal and staff are underpaid for the type of work that we work in, also in our roles we have to do personal care( i.e changing soiled pads ect) and other jobs that are not given a full description. staff often have low morale due to poor management. hub leaders often can be condescending to staff and support plans are not followed through.

service users in some services are denied oppertunity to go swimming due to a number of staff not wanting to go swimming or are unable to do so for religious reason( when in interviews they stated that they will take people we support swimming. staff got  away with lying in their interviews.

I should mention that radio 119 in rund by hft only get 15 mins a fortnight of air time, when in fact the service has the potential for weekly one hour shows and podcast. which mangers denied and also state it was down to BCB( the buildings owner to allocate air) when i asked bcb the stated that hft insisted on only 15 mins a fortnight this is supressing disabled peoples voiced and laos restricting to what they can be doing on a weekly and daily basis. on average the shows can be produced withing a week. i had the relevent degree and experience in radio production which hft failed and refused to utilise.
